title: How Many Calories Are in Ramen Noodles?
meta_description: Discover how many calories are in ramen noodles with full nutrition breakdown per package, including carbs, protein, fat, sodium, and easy tweaks for healthier options.
h1: How Many Calories Are in Ramen Noodles?
assumptions: Instant ramen noodles, standard 85g dry package, prepared with included seasoning packet, no additional toppings or oil.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by brand, flavor, preparation method, and added ingredients. Check packaging for exact values.

quick_answer.text: One standard package of instant ramen noodles contains about 380 calories.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts fields for easy comparison.

tweaks.label: Skip the seasoning packet (use low-sodium broth instead)
Add one boiled egg as topping
Use brown rice ramen noodles (healthier alternative)

faqs.q: How many calories are in a package of instant ramen noodles?
faqs.a: Approximately 380 calories for a standard 85g dry package.

faqs.q: What's the sodium content in ramen noodles?
faqs.a: One package has about 1580 mg of sodium, mostly from the seasoning packet.

faqs.q: Are ramen noodles high in carbs?
faqs.a: Yes, around 54 g of carbs per package, primarily from refined wheat flour.

faqs.q: How can I reduce calories in ramen noodles?
faqs.a: Omit the seasoning packet, add veggies, or choose lower-calorie rice-based versions.

faqs.q: Do ramen noodles have any protein?
faqs.a: About 9 g per package, but adding eggs or tofu can boost it significantly.
